user_profile_view.introduction: The User Profile Page allows users to view their account details and make changes if they are the profile owner. Below are the key features and functionalities available on this page:

profile_information.title: Profile Information Display
profile_information.desc1: The page displays user details such as username, first name, last name, and email address.
profile_information.desc2: All fields are <0>read-only</0> to prevent accidental modifications.

edit_profile.title: Editing Profile Information
edit_profile.desc1: If you are the owner of the profile, you can edit your details by clicking the <0>Edit Profile</0> button.
edit_profile.desc2: You will be redirected to the profile editing page where you can update your information.

changing_password.title: Changing Password
changing_password.desc1: To update your password, click the <0>Change Password</0> button.
changing_password.desc2: This will redirect you to a secure form where you can enter your current password and set a new one.

user_profile_edit.introduction: The User Profile Edit Page allows you to update your personal information, such as your first name, last name, and email address. Follow the steps below to edit your profile:

profile_information.title: Updating Your Information
profile_information.desc1: The <0>Username</0> field is <0>read-only</0> and cannot be changed.

desc2_dict.title: You can modify the following fields (<0>all required</0>):

profile_information.desc3: Click inside the field you want to edit and enter the new information.

saving_changes.title: Saving Changes
saving_changes.desc1: After updating your details, click the <0>Save</0> button.
saving_changes.desc2: If the update is successful, you will be redirected to your profile page, and a confirmation message will appear.

error_handling.title: Error Handling
error_handling.desc1: If any required field is left empty, an alert message will appear asking you to fill it in.
error_handling.desc2: If there are other errors (e.g., invalid email format), an alert message will appear below the corresponding field.
error_handling.desc3: Review the error messages, correct the issues, and try saving again.

canceling_changes.title: Canceling Changes
canceling_changes.desc1: If you decide not to update your profile, you can navigate back to your profile page without saving, click the <0>Cancel</0> button.

user_profile_edit.note: <0>Note</0>: Your changes will only be saved after clicking the <0>Save</0> button. If you leave the page without saving, your previous information will remain unchanged.

user_change_password.introduction: This form allows users to change their password securely. Users must enter their current password and set a new one. The form validates the inputs and ensures that the new password meets security requirements.

filling_out.title: Filling Out the Form
filling_out.desc1: Enter your current password in the <0>Old Password</0> field.
filling_out.desc2: Enter a new password in the <0>New Password</0> field.
filling_out.desc3: Confirm the new password by re-entering it in the <0>Confirm New Password</0> field.
filling_out.desc4: Ensure both new password fields match.

submitting.title: Submitting the Form
submitting.desc1: Click the <0>Save</0> button to submit the form.
submitting.desc2: If successful, you will be redirected back to the previous page with a confirmation message.
submitting.desc3: If there are errors (e.g., incorrect old password or mismatched new passwords), they will be displayed as alerts.

signup.introduction: The sign-up form allows new users to create an account securely. All fields in the form are required, and the inputs must meet validation criteria.

desc1_dict.title: Username:
desc1_dict.desc2: The username should not contain spaces.

desc4_dict.title: Email:
desc4_dict.desc1: Enter a valid email address (e.g., user@example.com).

desc5_dict.title: Password:
desc5_dict.desc1: Enter a secure password that meets security requirements (e.g., minimum length, special characters, and numbers may be required).

desc6_dict.title: Confirm Password:
desc6_dict.desc1: Re-enter the same password to confirm. Ensure both password fields match.

submitting.title: Submitting the Form
submitting.desc1: Click the <0>Sign Up</0> button to submit the form.
submitting.desc2: If all fields are correctly filled, you will be redirected to the home page with a confirmation message.
submitting.desc3: If there are errors, they will be displayed as alerts. Common errors include: missing required fields, invalid email format, passwords not matching, or username/email already in use.

additional_notes.title: Additional Notes
additional_notes.desc1: If you already have an account, click on the Sign In link to log in.
additional_notes.desc2: Ensure you enter accurate information, as it will be used for account verification.

object_list.introduction: The {{object}} List allows users to view, filter, and manage {{objects}} efficiently.

navigating.title: Navigating the {{object}} List
navigating.desc1: The main page displays a list of {{objects}}.
navigating.desc2: On larger screens, the data is presented in a table format.
navigating.desc3: On smaller screens, the Partners appear as individual cards.

adding_object.title: Adding a New {{object}}
adding_object.desc1: Click the <0>Add</0> button (green) at the top of the page.
adding_object.desc2: You will be redirected to a new page where you can enter details for the new {{object}}.

filtering.title: Filtering Objects
filtering.desc1: Click the <0>Show Filters</0> button (orange) to display filter options.
filtering.desc2: Enter values in the fields to refine the {{object}} list.
filtering.desc3: The system will automatically validate date ranges (e.g., start date cannot be after end date).
filtering.desc4: To clear a specific filter field, click the <0>small trash</0> can icon next to the field.
filtering.desc5: Click the <0>Clear Filters</0> button (blue) to reset all filters.

foreign_keys.title: Selecting Foreign Key Fields
foreign_keys.desc1: Some fields require selecting values from another list (e.g., categories, references).
foreign_keys.desc2: Click on the field to open a selection modal.
foreign_keys.desc3: Choose the desired value, and it will be assigned to the corresponding field.

view_edit.title: Viewing and Editing {{objects}}
view_edit.desc1: Click on a {{object}} in the list to open its details page.
view_edit.desc2: On the details page, you may be able to edit, update or delete the {{object_s}} information.

scrolling.title: Infinite Scrolling
scrolling.desc1: The list automatically loads more data as you scroll.
scrolling.desc2: If additional pages are available, more {{objects}} will appear without needing to manually refresh the page.

no_results.title: Handling No Results
no_results.desc1: If no matching {{objects}} are found, a message 'No results found.' will be displayed.
no_results.desc2: Try adjusting the filters to expand the search.

object_view.introduction: The {{object}} View allows users to create, edit, and view {{objects}} within the system. Users can enter data, interact with foreign key fields, and submit the form for processing. The form ensures data integrity through validation.

desc1_dict.title: Adding a New {{object}}
desc1_dict.desc4: Correct any validation errors and resubmit if needed.

desc3_dict.title: Canceling an Operation
desc3_dict.desc1: Click <0>Cancel</0> to return to the previous page without saving changes.

desc4_dict.title: Deleting a {{object}}
desc4_dict.desc2: Confirm the deletion in the prompt to proceed.
desc4_dict.desc3: This action is irreversible, and the {{object}} cannot be restored.
desc4_dict.desc4: The system will check if the {{object}} is referenced in another record.
desc4_dict.desc5: If deletion is not possible, an error message will appear: 'Cannot delete this item because it is referenced in another record.'

navigating.title: Navigating the Form
navigating.desc1: Fields are grouped for ease of use.
navigating.desc2: Foreign key fields allow selecting related objects via a modal window.
navigating.desc3: Validation messages appear below fields when errors occur.

foreidn_key.title: Foreign Key Selection
foreidn_key.desc1: Click the respective field to open a selection modal.
foreidn_key.desc3: The selected object is displayed in the form.

error_handling.title: Error Handling
error_handling.desc1: If any required field is left empty, an alert message will appear asking you to fill it in.
error_handling.desc2: If there are other errors (e.g., invalid email format), an alert message will appear below the corresponding field.
error_handling.desc3: Review the error messages, correct the issues, and try saving again.

submitting.title: Submitting the Form
submitting.desc1: Upon successful submission, a confirmation message appears.
submitting.desc2: Changes are saved and immediately reflected.
submitting.desc3: New objects redirect to their detail page after creation.

pessimistic_locking.title: Pessimistic Locking
pessimistic_locking.desc1: To prevent conflicts in multi-user environments, the system uses pessimistic locking when a user edits an item.
pessimistic_locking.desc2: When a user clicks <0>Edit</0>, the system locks the item for <0>20 minutes</0>.
pessimistic_locking.desc3: While locked, other users cannot modify the item.
pessimistic_locking.desc4: The lock automatically expires after <0>20 minutes</0> if no action is taken.

add_edit_partner.introduction: The Partner Form allows users to create or edit a Partner record by entering relevant details and ensuring all required fields meet validation criteria. This guide outlines how to use the form, including field descriptions and validation rules.

trade_name_dict.title: Trade Name:
trade_name_dict.desc1: Enter the trade name of the partner.
trade_name_dict.desc2: This field is required and must not exceed 255 characters.

full_name_dict.title: Full Name:
full_name_dict.desc1: Enter the full legal name of the partner.
full_name_dict.desc2: The full name must not exceed 255 characters.

bin_dict.title: Business Identification Number (BIN):
bin_dict.desc1: Enter the Business Identification Number of the partner.
bin_dict.desc2: This field is required and must not exceed 20 characters.

partner_type_dict.title: Partner Type:
partner_type_dict.desc1: Select the type of partner from the dropdown list.
partner_type_dict.desc2: Ensure you select an appropriate type.

legal_address_dict.title: Legal Address:
legal_address_dict.desc1: Enter the legal address of the partner.

actual_address_dict.title: Actual Address:
actual_address_dict.desc1: Enter the actual address of the partner.

phone_number_dict.title: Phone Number:
phone_number_dict.desc1: Enter the contact phone number of the partner.
phone_number_dict.desc2: Must be in international format (e.g., +1234567890). Maximum length is 255 characters.

contact_person_dict.title: Contact Person:
contact_person_dict.desc1: Enter the name of the contact person.
contact_person_dict.desc2: This field is required and must not exceed 255 characters.

is_own_dict.title: Own Partner:
is_own_dict.desc1: Check this box if the partner is an internal entity.

error_handling.title: Error Handling
error_handling.desc1: If any required field is left empty, an alert message will appear asking you to fill it in.
error_handling.desc2: If there are other errors (e.g., invalid email format), an alert message will appear below the corresponding field.
error_handling.desc3: Review the error messages, correct the issues, and try saving again.

submitting.title: Submitting the Form
submitting.desc4: Upon successful submission, a confirmation message will appear, and the new partner record will be created.

add_edit_partner.note: <0>Note</0>: The fields 'ID', 'Created At', and 'Updated At' are read-only. These fields are automatically managed by the system and cannot be modified by the user.

add_edit_payment_request.introduction: The Payment Request Form allows users to create or edit a Payment Request record by entering relevant details and ensuring all required fields meet validation criteria. This guide outlines how to use the form, including field descriptions and validation rules.

payer_dict.title: Payer:
payer_dict.desc1: Select the payer from the available options.

recipient_dict.title: Recipient:
recipient_dict.desc1: Select the recipient from the available options.

invoice_number_dict.title: Invoice Number:
invoice_number_dict.desc1: Enter the invoice number associated with the payment request.

invoice_date_dict.title: Invoice Date:
invoice_date_dict.desc1: Enter the date of the invoice.
invoice_date_dict.desc2: This field is required and must be in the correct date format.

invoice_amount_dict.title: Invoice Amount:
invoice_amount_dict.desc1: Enter the total amount of the invoice.
invoice_amount_dict.desc2: The value must be greater than or equal to 0.

payment_priority_dict.title: Payment Priority:
payment_priority_dict.desc1: Enter the priority of the payment request (1-10).
payment_priority_dict.desc2: The value must be between 1 and 10.

payment_amount_dict.title: Payment Amount:
payment_amount_dict.desc1: Enter the amount requested for payment.
payment_amount_dict.desc2: The value must be greater than or equal to 0.

deadline_dict.title: Deadline:
deadline_dict.desc1: Enter the deadline for the payment request.
deadline_dict.desc2: This field must be in the correct date format.

comment_dict.title: Comment:
comment_dict.desc1: Enter any additional comments regarding the payment request.

error_handling.title: Error Handling
error_handling.desc1: If any required field is left empty, an alert message will appear asking you to fill it in.
error_handling.desc2: If any field contains an invalid value (e.g., negative amounts or incorrect date format), an alert message will appear below the corresponding field.
error_handling.desc3: Review the error messages, correct the issues, and try saving again.

submitting.title: Submitting the Form
submitting.desc4: Upon successful submission, a confirmation message will appear, and the new payment request record will be created.

add_edit_payment_request.note: <0>Note</0>: The fields 'ID', 'User', 'Created At', and 'Updated At' are read-only. These fields are automatically managed by the system and cannot be modified by the user.
